intro: Pentacalia favillosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and covered in a fine, velvety texture. The flowers bloom in clusters, making it a visually striking addition to gardens and natural ecosystems.
